faq.question: What is HTML?
faq.answer: HTML (Hypertext Markup Language) is the standard markup language for creating web pages. It is used to structure content on the web.

faq.question: What is the difference between front-end and back-end development?
faq.answer: Front-end development refers to the part of a website that users interact with, while back-end development involves server-side logic, databases, and application functionality.

faq.question: What is responsive web design?
faq.answer: Responsive web design is an approach to web design that makes web pages render well on a variety of devices and screen sizes by using flexible layouts, images, and CSS media queries.

faq.question: What are CSS frameworks?
faq.answer: CSS frameworks like Bootstrap and Tailwind provide pre-written CSS code that helps in building responsive and consistent layouts quickly, without writing custom CSS from scratch.

faq.question: What is a REST API?
faq.answer: A REST API (Representational State Transfer) is a web service that allows interaction with servers through HTTP requests to GET, POST, PUT, or DELETE data.
